content.rendered:
Tokeny Insights July 2019

Hello

Welcome to this month‘s edition of Tokeny Insights.

In terms of adoption, real estate is building strong foundations in the tokenization space. Globally, in the professionally managed industry, the size of the real estate investment market reached $8.9 trillion in 2018, up from $8.5 in 2017 (according to MSCI). That being said, today the real estate industry has significant barriers to entry. The involvement of many middlemen results in expensive lending for issuers. For investors, the lack of liquidity is a stumbling block. Fundamentally, capital formation is currently difficult to achieve for issuers using traditional methods.

Real estate can benefit in a big way from blockchain technology. As it stands, investment in this kind of asset class is attractive to investors thanks to the low interest rates. Not only that, but by utilizing this cash-on-cash formula, investors will be able to calculate the ratio between annual operational net cash flow and the total equity that had been invested in the deal, thus giving them a rough idea about how worthwhile their investment could be. Overall, this could determine which properties they ultimately decide to invest their money into. Referring back to the former though, as tokenization begins to develop, the utilisation of this technology will allow for fractional ownership and the democratization of investment. If we look longer term, as more and more projects come to the fore, exchanges and marketplaces will go live and enable investors to buy and sell their assets at any time, making real estate products as liquid as stocks or bonds.

Best wishes,

Luc Falempin
Tokeny CEO

MARKET SPOTLIGHT

Significant news and insights selected by our team of security token experts

Euronext Invests €5M in Blockchain Fintech Tokeny Solutions

Pan-European exchange Euronext has made a €5 million investment in tokenization platform Tokeny Solutions.

Euronext

Read more

BTG Pactual and Dalma Capital Adopt Tezos for STOs

BTG Pactual and asset manager Dalma Capital will launch security token offerings (STOs) on the self-amending blockchain and smart contracts platform Tezos.

FinTech Futures

Read more

Europe Completes its First Ever Blockchain Real Estate Sale for €6.5 Million

Last week, the AnnA Villa in Paris made history by becoming the first ever European property to be sold entirely via blockchain transaction.

Forbes

Read more

How Blockchain Could Change the Real Estate Investment Landscape

An increasing number of countries have begun the process of implementing functional and legal frameworks to regulate blockchain-recorded tokens over the past several months.

Cointelegraph

Read more

Peakside Plans €200m Fundraise for Office Fund via ScalingFunds Blockchain

Peakside Capital Advisors is planning to raise €200m on a blockchain-powered platform for a newly launched German office properties fund.

IPE Real Assets

Read more

KPMG, State Street and LHoFT Award Tokeny With Coveted Fintech 2019 Prize

The contest was organised by KPMG Luxembourg and LHoFT and there were 194 applications from 33 different countries.

Tokeny Solutions

Read more

COMPLIANCE IN FOCUS

Compliance and regulatory news curated by our team of industry insiders

Security Tokens Reach a National Stock Market for the First Time via Seychelles Securities Exchange

As of late-June 2019, security tokens are reaching a national stock exchange in a touted ‘world-first’ which could shake up the trading industry so be sure to keep an eye out on any dramatic change on your stock trading apps south africa. The MERJ Exchange, which initiated operations in 2013, is set to list tokenized shares.

The Tokenist

Read more

Gemini to Apply for Broker-Dealer License in Bid to Trade Crypto Securities

The Winklevoss-owned cryptocurrency exchange Gemini will apply for a broker-dealer license from the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA), CoinDesk has learned.

CoinDesk

Read more

Why Have Regulators Reacted so Strongly to Libra by Facebook?

It didn’t take long. Within hours of Libra being announced the global regulatory system had plenty of opinions on what it meant and how it needed to be governed.

11 FS

Read more

China’s Central Bank Developing Own Digital Currency in Response to Libra

China’s central bank is reportedly developing its own digital currency in response to Facebook’s Libra as the latter could purportedly pose a risk to the country’s financial system.

Cointelegraph

Read more
